channel.title: Propositional Atoms :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: Definition A propositional atom is statement that is either true or false, and that contains no logical connectives (like and, or, not, if/then). Examples of propositional atoms For example, the following are propositional atoms: My shirt is red. It is sunny. Pigs can fly. I studied for the test. Examples of what are NOT propositional atoms Propositional atoms should not contain any logical connectives. If they did, this would mean we could have further subdivided the statement into multiple propositional atoms that could be joined with logical operators.
